title: Socio-technical Instructional Design for Enhancing Maritime Safety and Crisis Response Capabilities: Building Citizen Participation and Community Collaboration Systems

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic maritime safety terminology, computer and internet proficiency, foundational knowledge of social relationships and collaborative processes, basic concepts of civic rights and community systems
context.additional_context: Customized curriculum for systematically acquiring practical competencies required in hazardous environments and citizen-participatory safety culture. Emphasizes institutional improvements for marine accident prevention (policies, laws, economic incentives) and community collaboration strategies (reflecting cultural characteristics, analyzing historical cases, considering geographical conditions). Role-playing activities among learners simulate political interest coordination.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze 3 uncertainty cases in marine work environments (e.g., ship collision avoidance, marine structure safety assessment) using fuzzy set theory, simulate fuzzy logic-based modeling with ≥80% accuracy, and propose reports for improving marine safety policies, including strategies to strengthen civil rights and community safety systems.

By integrating axiomatic design methodology with a socio-technical systems approach, learners can systematically derive functional requirements and stakeholder (government, corporations, civic groups) collaboration frameworks for marine safety protocols, particularly establishing multi-stakeholder coordination strategies considering cultural differences.

Through virtual simulations, learners can perform decision-making processes during marine emergencies with ≥90% accuracy, propose citizen engagement and community collaboration plans (e.g., volunteer networks, community-based monitoring systems) for crisis management, and include geographical characteristic reflection plans based on historical cases.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
